alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 03 at 5:51AM CDT until April 03 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 645 AM CDT. * At 550 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Goodwater to 3 miles west of Tuckers Crossing, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Clara, Tibbie, Millry, Buckatunna and Silas. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
